channel.title: PAAW
channel.description: The Performance Adaptive Aeroelastic Wing program. Yes, it's a morphing wing!

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • UMN
    • Sköll with WS1 complete, flight attempted on 2015-06-16, but scrubbed due to intermittent faults with ground support equipment.
    • Next Sköll flight attempt will be Tuesday, 2015-06-23.
    • Hati center-body and wing layup with WS2 complete. Wings (WS2) will be built as flexible wings. Anticipating ready for flexible aircraft flights 1st week of July.
  • STI
    • Transitioning from flight data analysis on Fenrir to model development.
    • A structure only Reduced Order Model (ROM) has been built.
    • Anticipating 1 ROM complete next week, linear model at 1 flight condition, likely around when BFF goes unstable.
  • CM Soft
    • Unsteady aeroelastic simulation with the c.g. held fixed.
    • Inviscid flow with a step input.
    • Used to find damping ratio as a function of airspeed.
    • Estimating an 11-14 Hz mode is going unstable at around 78 - 80 knots.
    • Not much variation with altitude.
    • May be useful to look at reactions at the center node.
  • VT
    • Working on a drag buildup.
    • Mostly friction and form drag at our test conditions, low induced drag contributions.
    • Adding contribution from leading edge flaps.
    • Similar to CM Soft, not finding much variation with altitude.

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Flight tests on Fenrir complete with the following control laws validated:
    • Pitch and roll angle tracking
    • Auto throttle / airspeed hold
    • Auto approach and landing
  • Sköll MOI testing complete with the following values:
    • Ixx: 3.098 kg-m^2
    • Iyy: 0.464 kg-m^2
    • Izz: 3.315 kg-m^2
    • Mass: 6.2698 kg
  • Changes will now be tracked from this baseline and updates to the mass and inertia will be sent.
  • Sköll rigid flight test plan:
    • Ganged surface excitations to identify SISO system
    • Individual control surface excitations
    • Pitch multisines
    • Airspeeds: 20 m/s, 30 m/s, 40 m/s

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Mass properties testing of Sköll complete, analysis in progress.
  • Flight software updated for Sköll.
  • Next parameter estimation flight tests should include ganged 3-2-1-1 excitations with the same allocation as the control software to provide SISO identification.

item.title: Status
item.description:
• Monthly technical meetings with NASA researchers will occur on the last Monday or Wednesday of every month at 3 PM Central Time. The next meeting is scheduled for Wednesday May 27.

Status Update

mAEWing1

  • Fabrication of Sköll (Wikipedia, Pronunciation) with wing set 1 (WS1) is complete. Wiring and electrical integration is expected to be complete early the week of May 18 followed by mass properties testing.
  • VT, CM Soft, and Dave updated models and completed preliminary flutter analysis.
  • Found flutter speed sensitive to c.g. location. Will update models following mass properties testing on Sköll.
  • Have about 7 papers for SciTech session.

item.title: Status
item.description:
• Planning on holding monthy technical meetings with NASA researchers. Notionally these will be the last Thursday of every month at 2 PM Central Time, need to check on availability.

Status Update

mAEWing1

  • CM Soft converted FEM model, good matching with VT FEM model
  • FEM model surfaces are deployable
  • Current FEM is best and final prior to updating with experimental data from mass properties and GVT testing
  • Next steps:
    • Compute flutter speeds
    • Create Reduced Order Models for control law design (MIDAAS and UMN LPV)
  • Dave S. Flight Dynamics Model has preliminary flutter speeds
    • Sensitive to Cmq
      • Important to BFF, investigating the relationship
    • Longitudinal dynamics only
    • Will have linear models in about 1 week
  • VT has a preliminary flutter analysis complete
    • Will update using Zaero
  • STI is collecting abstracts for a special session planned at SciTech on PAAW
  • STI has a preliminary draft for the ASE model survey
    • Inlcudes descriptions of modeling approaches used sorted by aircraft
    • UMN will update to include more general descriptions of modeling approaches
  • mAEWing1 center body construction complete, systems integration in work
    • Anticipating a mid May completion of the first mAEWing1 aircraft

item.title: Status
item.description:
• Recap of Aerospace Flutter and Dynamics Council meeting from Dave S.

Status Update

mAEWing1

  • VT updated FEM to include:
    • Spring elements for control surfaces
    • Point mass locations for flaps
    • Accelerometer locations
  • CM Soft received updated FEM and is in process of converting for their use in CFD / CSD model

mAEWing2

  • VT updated shape optimization algorithm

item.title: Status
item.description:
Status Update

  • STI started ASE model survey document
  • Invited session at Science and Technology Forum next year focused on PAAW

mAEWing1 modeling

  • CFD / CSD model
    • CFD and FEM models complete
    • CM Soft converting format and adding control surfaces
    • Should have CFD / CSD model in the next couple weeks
  • Reduced Order Models
    • Determine number of modes
      • Probably the first 6 modes in each axis
      • Within bandwidth of actuators (10 - 14 Hz) and slightly above
    • Velocity range 20 - 60 knots in 10 knot increments
    • Should be complete in the next 3 - 4 weeks
  • FEM Update
    • mAEWing1 WS1 build, static, and dynamic testing complete
    • Can update mass properties in model
  • Future FEM models should include:
    • Elements for control surfaces
    • Nodes at the sensor locations

mAEWing2

  • VT wing shape optimization progress, will get an update next week

item.title: Tactical Meeting, UMN and Aurora
item.description:
• Aurora has contacts with foam core suppliers that can meet mAEWing1 tolerances, will contact them to discuss supplying future center body and wing foam cores
  • mAEWing2 mold construction will be lead through Aurora, either in-house or through subcontracts
    • UMN will post preliminary mAEWing2 OML
    • Need to define mAEWing2 material and manufacturing process, whether autoclave or heat application is needed will affect tooling material choices
    • mAEWing2 tooling will need integration guides
  • Aurora will begin working with NASA AFRC on xAEWing3 airworthiness requirements, procedures, and documentation
    • UMN will work to find the NASA flight approval process
  • Aurora will begin working on a manufacturing plan for xAEWing3, including determining design review milestone dates needed to have a completed wing ready in time to meet program milestones.
    • Likely will include a concept design review, preliminary design review, and critical/manufacturing design review
    • Need to determine whether we use hard or soft tooling. Soft tooling will work for the program, but hard tooling may be desired by NASA for future research.

item.title: Status
item.description:
• The updated center body, being built and integrated for the mAEWing1 flight testing, will be named Sköll. As a reminder the previous center body that was used for systems and operational development work, and is being used for some rigid flight testing, is called Fenrir.
  • We will start referring to the wings by wing type and a wing set number. So the current set of wings being integrated is mAEWing1 Wing Set 1 or mAEWing1 WS1.

Status Updates

mAEWing 1

  • mAEWing1 design v2.3 has been released. This should be considered the build to configuration.
  • mAEWing1 WS 1 is nearing completion:
    • Actuators and linkages have been installed
    • Wiring and accelerometer installation is nearing completion (expected completion date 20150407)
  • mAEWing1 WS 1 testing:
    • Static testing complete
    • Dynamic testing expected to be complete by 20150410
    • Freeplay test complete
      • Found less than about 0.25 degrees of freeplay. The linkage and hinge have no freeplay, all of the freeplay is in the actuator. This test was rudimentary, but the freeplay is low enough that we’re not planning further testing unless simulation and analysis show that we need more accurate information.
  • Foam delivered from a supplier for Sköll center body was very out of spec, should receive updated parts from our supplier week of April 6
  • Overall, we’re running 1 - 2 weeks behind schedule for mAEWing1 build and test; instead of an April 20th completion date, we’re now projecting early May.
  • FEM complete for mAEWing1, will update with GVT data when it becomes available.
  • CFD complete for mAEWing1, will begin work on CFD/CSD model.

mAEWing2

  • MDAO approach and research plan for mAEWing2 complete.
  • Preliminary CFD for mAEWing2 complete.

item.title: Status
item.description:
• UMN to measure mAEWing1 actuator freeplay
  • Will likely leave mAEWing1 stiff for initial flights to gather aerodynamic data, then cut skin and foam to be flexible for flutter suppression and shape modification
  • Dave S sent a working paper on preliminary aerodynamic results. Need to estimate pitching moment from the body flaps during flight tests; this control surface is a large contributor to flutter suppression, but has very low pitching moment effectiveness (primarily contributes lift force)
  • Further analysis of Fenrir flight indicates that increasing the rigid body pitch damper gain could have excited the center-body flexibility. Updates to the aircraft design for mAEWing1 should remove this flexibility.
  • VT finished the mAEWing1 FEM model and will be verifying the model with UMN. VT also conducted some preliminary aero modeling for mAEWing1, which is being used to develop MDAO tools for the mAEWing2 design.
  • The mAEWing1 FEM model will be updated following Ground Vibration Testing.
